title: Introduction
header: Web design became my passion in the middle of last year. Since then, I have learned numerous technologies. Some of them have been more to my liking than others. Thus, ever since I have discovered React, I stayed with it for longer. In the meantime, I also learned Node.js, which allows me to quickly create a fully-fledged backend for websites when combined with MongoDB. In the near future, I want to learn a technology that will let me write mobile applications. It will probably be ReactNative.

headings.name: Well designed
headings.description: The pages I create are always designed by me from the bottom up. For this purpose, I most often use Figma. What is more, I regularly check other pages and blogs dedicated to web design in order to keep up to date with the trends in this rapidly changing environment.

headings.name: Fast
headings.description: The pages I create are optimised both by me, during the development, and by the technologies found in the libraries used during the creation of the production page. Recently, I have a very special appreciation for Gatsby.js, which allows for the creation of extremely fast websites.

headings.name: SEO
headings.description: SEO is often associated with the process of page optimisation, but in practice, it provides much more opportunities. It also allows for the improvement of technical aspects of the website, content expansion, and link building.

headings.name: Responsive
headings.description: I am creating websites with a 'Mobile First' approach. This means that I start designing from the smallest devices and resolutions so that the experience of using them is the best it can be. Then, as the resolution increases, I continuously add new features and expand the page layout.

upcomingSkills.name: Next.js
upcomingSkills.description: Next.js is an open-source React front-end web development framework that enables features such as server-side rendering and static website generation for web applications on React.

upcomingSkills.name: PHP
upcomingSkills.description: PHP - an interpreted, scripting programming language designed to generate web pages and build web applications in real time.

upcomingSkills.name: WordPress
upcomingSkills.description: WordPress - a content management system written in PHP, designed mainly for blogs. It uses the MySQL database. It is distributed under the GNU General Public License and is available free of charge.

skills.name: HTML
skills.description: HTML allows to describe the structure of information contained inside the website, giving the appropriate semantic meaning to individual text fragments - forming hyperlinks, paragraphs, headings, lists - and embeds file objects in the text of the document, e.g. multimedia or database elements, e.g. interactive data forms.

skills.name: CSS
skills.description: Cascading style sheets - a language used to describe the form of presentation of websites. CSS was developed by the W3C in 1996 as a descendant of DSSSL for use in conjunction with SGML. The first draft of the CSS was proposed in 1994 by HÃ¥kon Wium Lie.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: The most common use of JavaScript is web pages. These scripts are most often used to provide interaction by reacting to events, validating data entered in forms or creating complex visual effects. JavaScript scripts run by websites have significantly limited access to the user's computer.

skills.name: TypeScript
skills.description: TypeScript - A free and open source programming language developed by Microsoft as a superset of JavaScript. It enables optional static typing and class-based object-oriented programming.

skills.name: React
skills.description: React.js - JavaScript programming language library, which is used to create graphical interfaces of web applications. It was created by Jordan Walke, a Facebook developer, and inspired by the PHP language extension XHP.

skills.name: Gatsby
skills.description: Gatsby is a framework that allows you to build lightning-fast websites and web applications based on React JS. It allows you to easily optimize the website code. The uniqueness of Gatsby is that it combines the advantages of many other solutions.

skills.name: Node.js
skills.description: Node.js is an open source, cross-platform runtime for developing server-side applications written in JavaScript. It contributed to the 'JavaScript everywhere' paradigm by allowing programmers to build applications within one programming language instead of relying on separate ones on the server side.

skills.name: Mongodb
skills.description: MongoDB - an open, non-relational database management system written in C ++. It is characterized by high scalability, efficiency and the lack of a strictly defined structure of supported databases.

skills.name: GraphQL
skills.description: GraphQL is an open source query and data manipulation language for APIs and a runtime for populating queries with existing data. GraphQL was developed internally by Facebook in 2012.

skills.name: Material UI
skills.description: React components based on Material Design methodology for faster and easier web development.

skills.name: NPM
skills.description: Npm - the default package manager for Node.js, can also be used to manage the front-end layer of web applications.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: Git - distributed version control system. It was created by Linus Torvalds as a tool to aid the development of the Linux kernel. Git is free software and is released under the GNU GPL version 2.

skills.name: SASS
skills.description: Sass is a preprocessor scripting language that is interpreted or compiled into cascading style sheets. SassScript is the scripting language itself. Sass consists of two syntaxes. The original syntax, called 'indented syntax', uses a Haml-like syntax.

skills.name: Redux
skills.description: Redux is an open source JavaScript library for managing application state. It is most often used in libraries like React or Angular to build user interfaces. Like the Flux architecture on Facebook, it was created by Dan Abramov and Andrew Clark.

skills.name: Jest
skills.description: It is a JavaScript testing framework operated by Facebook, Inc. designed and built by Christoph Nakazawa with an emphasis on simplicity and support for large web applications. Works with projects using Babel, TypeScript, Node.js, React, Angular, Vue.js, and Svelte.
